channel.title: Blender Magazine on My New Hugo Site

item.title: A Magazine You Can't Bend
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: The promise of multimedia technology led creators of all stripes to do particularly crazy things in an effort to seem hip and with the times. The CD-ROM, much like the sound card, was seen as the lynchpin for much of this innovationâ€”as it could hold a large amount of data, making room for audio, video, and interactive features that no piece of paper, glossy or otherwise, could pull off.
